message:
Personally, I would only expose async methods. It's extremely rare that consumers *have* to block - they just *want* to.

The only other safe way is to have both sync and async methods. You don't want one to be a wrapper for the other, though - what you should do is use the "bool argument hack" described in my article ( [https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/magazine/mt238404.aspx](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/magazine/mt238404.aspx) ) which enables you to write one sync+async method containing your actual logic, and then have sync and async wrappers around that.
